intro: Tarenna capuroniana, commonly known as the Capuron's tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Tarenna capuroniana is typically found in moist, shaded forest habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
